intro: Licania silvae, commonly known as the forest licania, is a climbing vine native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Licania silvae thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystem in its native habitat.
